Package com.example.circleapp.Firebase

Class FirebaseManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.circleapp.Firebase.FirebaseManager
public class FirebaseManager extends Object
Manages interactions with Firebase Firestore.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.AttendeesCallback
    Callback interface for Firestore operations with attendees.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.CheckInCountCallback
    Callback interface for Firestore operations with an event's check-in count.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.EventCallback
    Callback interface for Firestore operations with a single event.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.EventsCallback
    Callback interface for Firestore operations with events.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.URLCallback
    Callback interface for Firestore operations with URLs.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.UserDocumentCallback
    Callback interface for Firestore operations with user documents.

  • Constructor Details

    • FirebaseManager

      public FirebaseManager()
      Constructs a new FirebaseManager instance. Contains all methods used to manage, query and retrieve data from the Firestore database.

      Gets the singleton instance of FirebaseManager.

      Returns:

    • checkUserExists

      public void checkUserExists(FirebaseManager.UserDocumentCallback callback)
      Searches Firestore database to check if a user exists for the current phone.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback to execute with the boolean representing if the user exists or not.

    • checkProfileExists

      public void checkProfileExists(String ID, FirebaseManager.UserDocumentCallback callback)
      Searches Firestore database to check if a profile exists for the current user.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback to execute with the boolean representing if the profile exists or not.

    • getAllUsers

      public void getAllUsers(FirebaseManager.AttendeesCallback callback)
      Retrieves all users of the app from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback to execute with the events list

    • getRegisteredUsers

      public void getRegisteredUsers(FirebaseManager.AttendeesCallback callback, String eventID)
      Retrieves registered users for the current event from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback to execute with the events list
      eventID - The ID of the event we want to find the registered users for

      updates - The updated information passed by editUser()

    • editEvent

      public void editEvent(Event event)
      Edits an existing event in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to edit

    • trackCheckIns

      public void trackCheckIns(String eventId, Consumer<Integer> onAttendanceCountUpdated)
      Tracks the number of check-ins for a specific event and updates the attendance count accordingly.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique identifier of the event to track check-ins for.
      onAttendanceCountUpdated - A Consumer functional interface to handle updates to the attendance count. It accepts an Integer parameter representing the current count of attendees.

    • addAnnouncement

      public void addAnnouncement(String eventId, Announcement announcement, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<Void> listener)
      Adds an announcement to a specified event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to which the announcement will be added.
      announcement - The announcement to be added.
      listener - Listener to be invoked when the operation is complete.

    • loadAnnouncements

      public void loadAnnouncements(String eventId, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<List<Announcement>> listener)
      Loads announcements for a specified event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event for which announcements will be loaded.
      listener - Listener to be invoked when the operation is successful.

    • deleteAnnouncement

      public void deleteAnnouncement(String eventID, String announcementID, Runnable onSuccess, Consumer<String> onError)
      Deletes an announcement from a specified event.
      Parameters:
      eventID - The ID of the event from which the announcement will be deleted.
      announcementID - The ID of the announcement to be deleted.
      onSuccess - Runnable to be executed when the operation is successful.
      onError - Consumer to handle errors, accepting an error message.

    • updateAnnouncement

      public void updateAnnouncement(String eventId, Announcement announcement, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<Void> listener)
      Updates an existing announcement.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to which the announcement belongs.
      announcement - The updated announcement object.
      listener - Listener to be invoked when the operation is complete.

    • isAdmin

      public void isAdmin(FirebaseManager.UserDocumentCallback callback)
      Checks if the user is an admin.
      Parameters:
      callback - Callback to be invoked with the result of the check.

    • becomeAdmin

      public void becomeAdmin(String password)
      Grants admin privileges if the provided password matches.
      Parameters:
      password - The password to authenticate admin privilege grant.

    • addNewAdmin

      public void addNewAdmin()
      Adds a new admin to the system.

    • getPosterURLs

      public void getPosterURLs(FirebaseManager.URLCallback callback)
      Retrieves URLs of event posters.
      Parameters:
      callback - Callback to be invoked with the list of poster URLs.

    • getPFPURLs

      public void getPFPURLs(FirebaseManager.URLCallback callback)
      Retrieves URLs of user profile pictures.
      Parameters:
      callback - Callback to be invoked with the list of profile picture URLs.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String ID)
      Deletes a user from the system.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the user to be deleted.

    • deleteEvent

      public void deleteEvent(String ID)
      Deletes an event from the system.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the event to be deleted.

    • deleteImageUsage

      public void deleteImageUsage(String URL, boolean isPosterURL)
      Deletes usage of an image URL either as an event poster URL or a user profile picture URL.
      Parameters:
      URL - The URL of the image to be deleted.
      isPosterURL - Boolean indicating whether the URL is for an event poster.
